content:
Here is the manual for writing the first sentence of a product description. Learn from the given examples as a template.

Manual:
The first sentence always contains the product name, what the product is, and what it is used for. ​
Always start the description with the name of the product profile. Use the full name exactly as it is.​
Describe what the product is in a couple of words (adjective, adjective noun) when not obvious from the name. This is often a reference to the group the product is in.​
What the product is used for should be derived from the approved indications/intended use and/or manufacturer literature.​
When restating the indications/intended use, be concise while not excluding critical information. ​
Do not just restate the exact wording of the indications/intended use from the filing or other source that will be displayed on the profile as these will be shown on the same tab as well.​
State the components, materials, ingredients, etc. that make up the product.​
A layperson that has never heard of this product should be able to visualize it in their head or "put a face to a name" with the product image.​
What other product(s) is this used in conjunction with and how? If the product is meant to be used along with another product, explain the purpose and the end goal.​

Example 1:

The Anchor Tissue Retrieval System is used to capture and remove tissue and organs from the body during laparoscopic surgeries, including appendectomy, hysterectomy, cholecystectomy, and oophorectomy procedures.​

Filing: The Anchor Tissue Retrieval System is a sterile disposable pouch used with a dedicated introducer for the encapture and removal of an organ or tissue from the body cavity during laparoscopic surgery.​
Example 2:
The Target 360 Detachable Coil is an embolization coil used in neurovascular and peripheral vessels to occlude or obstruct the flow of blood, including use for intracranial aneurysms. ​

Filing: Target Coils are intended to endovascularly obstruct or occlude blood flow in vascular abnormalities of the neurovascular and peripheral vessels. Target Coils are indicated for endovascular embolization of: Intracranial aneurysms, other neurovascular abnormalities such as arteriovenous malformations and arteriovenous fistulae, arterial and venous embolizations in the peripheral vasculature​
